text:
Monica Echeverria Yañez (September 2, 1920 – January 3, 2020) was a Chilean journalist, writer, actress and professor. She was a feminist. She called herself a "rebel" and "anarchist" in the face of the neoliberal economics of the Chilean government. She was born in Santiago de Chile. In 2016, Mónica Echeverría published ¡Háganme Callar!.
As a writer she published her first book, "Antihistoria de un luchador", in 1993, it took eight years for her to finish this 500-page biography of the unionist Clotario Blest.
Echeverría died on January 3, 2020 in Santiago at the age of 99.
